sentences: Sa pead kutsuma oma sõpru pidule.
context: The Estonian word 'kutsuma' is an infinitive verb meaning 'to invite', 'to call', or 'to summon'. It belongs to the -ma infinitive group of Estonian verbs. When conjugated, it can appear in various forms like kutsub (he/she invites/calls), kutsusin (I invited/called), kutsuma (infinitive). The word is commonly used for inviting people to events or calling someone by name.
